Athletic Update: Governor Wolf's administration has revised spectator guidelines for athletics. Our district's athletic office has been working on a plan to address the limited spectator attendance requirement and social distancing requirements. Please bear with us as we work through this change.

The plan will allow limited attendance as we still need to adhere to the 250 spectator limit. Stay tuned...

post_text:
Athletic Update: Unfortunately due to the latest guidance from the Governor‚Äôs Office and PIAA, spectators will not be permitted to watch our sporting events in person. We apologize for this inconvenience and know that it impacts so many of us. Please do not crowd the fences as it will create a safety concern.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. We are advocating that a change will be made at the legislative level for local control on this issue.

Update: A bill was introduced in the legislature last Friday which calls for limited audience at sporting events. As this bill moves through the government, we will update our policy to reflect the new law. I would always encourage parents and community members to reach out to their legislators in support of this change.

-Mr. Netznik
text:
Athletic Update: Unfortunately due to the latest guidance from the Governor‚Äôs Office and PIAA, spectators will not be permitted to watch our sporting events in person. We apologize for this inconvenience and know that it impacts so many of us. Please do not crowd the fences as it will create a safety concern.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. We are advocating that a change will be made at the legislative level for local control on this issue.

Update: A bill was introduced in the legislature last Friday which calls for limited audience at sporting events. As this bill moves through the government, we will update our policy to reflect the new law. I would always encourage parents and community members to reach out to their legislators in support of this change.

-Mr. Netznik

post_text:
This Wednesday September 2nd is device pickup for all Virtual students including Virtual Live and Tulpehocken Virtual Academy. Device pickup is at the Junior-Senior High School from 9AM to 7PM for both programs. The Virtual Live students devices will be distributed in front of the Auditorium Entrance (Door 7) along the curb and the Tulpehocken Virtual Academy student devices will be distributed in front of the Library Entrance (Door 2) along the curb. Students will also be getting other school materials from teachers at this time. There will be signs at the main entrance directing where to go for each program.

If you have any questions please reach out to me at mshirk@tulpehocken.org or at 717-933-4611 extension 1081.

post_text:
Future Class of 2033 (that means kindergarten)...

Penn-Bernville:
Penn-Bernville Elementary is very excited to meet you! When dropping off your student(s) for their first day of school on Monday August 31 st, please use Door 7. This entrance is located in the back of the building and will be used for both arrival and dismissal. When full days begin for kindergarten the week of September 14, this will be a drop off/pick up and go procedure (where parents stay in the car). However, since kindergarten is starting before other students and because this is a special week for them, you are welcome to park and walk them to the door. Please remember to stay socially distanced from other families during this process.

Bethel:
Bethel Elementary is very excited to meet you! When dropping off your student(s) for Kindergarten Trojan Training on Monday August 31 st, please use Entrance A2. This Entrance is located in the front of the building facing Route 501, and is the entrance the busses use for student arrival and dismissal.

post_text:
In order to keep our students and staff safe and provide meals for all students (in-person/virtual), there will be several new procedures and meal programs in the cafeteria for the 2020-2021 school year.

‚Ä¢ Cashless/Touchless Transactions in the Lunch Lines
‚Ä¢ School Breakfast Send Home in the Afternoon (no breakfast served in the morning on the first day of school)
‚Ä¢ Virtual Wednesday Meals
‚Ä¢ Full Week Breakfast/Lunch Meals for Virtual Students
‚Ä¢ JSHS 11:30am Dismissal Lunches

Please click on the link below for details on all new procedures and programs.

https://www.tulpehocken.org/site/handlers/filedownload.ashx?moduleinstanceid=1809&dataid=3200&FileName=New%20Cafe%20Procedures%20and%20Programs.pdf

Contact Jillian Bergman, Director of Food Services with questions at jbergman@tulpehocken.org or 717-933-4611 X1042

From September 8, students would only attend on days 1,3,5 until the half days schedule is switched over to full days. The calendar shows a tentative BCTC schedule through September 30.

post_text:
Tulpehocken Jr-Sr High School is searching for a highly qualified, dynamic music teacher for a long-term substitute position. This position would be available from September 8th until the end of October. Successful candidate will teach general music, junior and senior high choral rehearsals, and beginning guitar courses. Knowledge of effective instructional techniques for choral rehearsals and experience in choir is preferred.
Interested individuals should apply via PA-Reap.net. and upload the following documents:
‚Ä¢ Resume
‚Ä¢ Valid PA State Police Criminal Check, PA Child Abuse History Certification and FBI Clearance
‚Ä¢ 3 Letters of Recommendation
‚Ä¢ PA Teaching Certificate
‚Ä¢ Transcripts

post_text:
Did you know... Choosing a Cyber Charter option costs the school district $14,497.44 for regular education students and $30,622.32 for students with special education services. Currently we have over 200 students interested in a virtual model. If half of those students attend an outside charter school the average cost could be over $2 million that was not budgeted.

Please consider Tulpehocken's virtual models when deciding what to do this fall. Our plan is to present virtual options at our August 4 Board Work Session at 7pm.

Notice is hereby given that the Board of School Directors of the Tulpehocken Area School District will have a special voting session board meeting on Monday, July 27, 2020 starting at 6:00 p.m. virtually through a Zoom Session in order to reconsider the district Health & Safety Plan. Instructions are below on how to access the Board Meeting.

The meeting will begin at 6:00pm via Zoom

Join Zoom Meeting

Join from a PC, Mac, iPad, iPhone or Android device:

Meeting ID: 648 318 6781

Password: 115856

Or join by phone:

Dial (for higher quality, dial a number based on your current location):

US: +1 312 626 6799 or +1 646 558 8656 or +1 301 715 8592 or +1 346 248 7799 or +1 669 900 9128 or +1 253 215 8782

Webinar ID: 648 318 6781

Password: 115856

post_text:
Good afternoon Tulpehocken Families and Staff,

As a follow up to the school board meeting last night where the Health and Safety Plan was presented. In effort to gain more information for the 2020-2021 school year we have put together a survey for you to complete. The survey can be found on our district website at www.tulpehocken.org. The link to the survey can be found below. Please complete the survey by Monday, July 27 so that the leadership team can plan accordingly for the 2020-2021 school year.

Survey Link: https://forms.gle/38W4sw2Wbe2txY6q9

At the August 4, 2020 school board meeting we will be presenting virtual options based off of the survey feedback.

Thank you and have a great day.

Mr. Netznik
Superintendent of Schools

Do you live in the Bernville/Tulpehocken Area School District area and are in need of food assistance (or know someone who is)? This Friday, May 22, from 10 a.m. - 12 p.m., we will be holding our first monthly distribution at our newest food pantry to be held in the parking lot of St. Thomas Church, 536 N. Main St. (Route 183), Bernville. The pantry will be operated by Helping Harvest volunteers and staff. We are so excited to bring this pantry to those in need in the Bernville, Pennsylvania area. If you are in need of food assistance, but live outside of this area, please call our office at 610-926-5802 ext 227 to be guided to help in your community.

Thank you for your patience.

post_text:
The artworks shown here are from the Tulpehocken Area School District Office Art Show that was scheduled to be on display from February 21 through April 2020. Please take a few moments to see the art work and enjoy the diversity of talent demonstrated by our students at the Bethel, Penn-Bernville, and Junior-Senior High schools. We are proud of the accomplishments of our students!

Due to the stay at home order, the display remains in place and will not be taken down until the beginning of the next school year. There was a tea that was scheduled to take place in April inviting families of the students to enjoy the artwork on display, unfortunately that was cancelled and has not been rescheduled.

Also due to the stay at home order, the art shows that normally take place in April and May have been cancelled as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3jwsC586l2g&feature=youtu.be

post_text:
This morning the Reading Eagle published an article about the U.S. News and World Report rankings of high schools across the state and nation. We are very pleased to announce that Tulpehocken Junior-Senior High School is ranked for 2020 in the top 25% of high schools in Pennsylvania and the United States. Locally in Berks County we are ranked in the top 1/3 of county high schools.

This is certainly a proud accomplishment for our community.

post_text:
Graduation Status:
We would like to thank all of the seniors and their families for participating in our Google Survey. Based on the results, we have tentatively scheduled outdoor graduation in our stadium for Thursday, July 30th, at 6 p.m. We will have a rain date scheduled for Friday, July 31st. Please understand that we are still working on logistics and planning for this event. We will need to adhere to guidelines given by the government regarding social distancing. Since we do not know what that will look like come July, decisions on the number of tickets given to each student will not be provided until a later date. Please know we are working diligently to ensure our seniors can participate in this monumental event highlighting the culmination of their years of hard work and dedication.
text:
Graduation Status:
We would like to thank all of the seniors and their families for participating in our Google Survey. Based on the results, we have tentatively scheduled outdoor graduation in our stadium for Thursday, July 30th, at 6 p.m. We will have a rain date scheduled for Friday, July 31st. Please understand that we are still working on logistics and planning for this event. We will need to adhere to guidelines given by the government regarding social distancing. Since we do not know what that will look like come July, decisions on the number of tickets given to each student will not be provided until a later date. Please know we are working diligently to ensure our seniors can participate in this monumental event highlighting the culmination of their years of hard work and dedication.

post_text: Good afternoon! The Governor has extended the school closures for the remainder of the year. As announced before, we will continue our current virtual learning plan. Please be patient as we work through this new experience. As always if you have concerns, please reach out to us.

Governor Wolf Extends School Closure for Remainder of Academic Year
text:
Good afternoon! The Governor has extended the school closures for the remainder of the year. As announced before, we will continue our current virtual learning plan. Please be patient as we work through this new experience. As always if you have concerns, please reach out to us.

Governor Wolf Extends School Closure for Remainder of Academic Year

post_text:
Notification sent out tonight...

Good evening,

Two weeks ago I put out a notification that stated schools will be in session April 6-13 for make up days. Unfortunately, I did not put in the announcement that schools would be closed April 10. PA Code actually states that schools are to be closed on Good Friday. I apologize for the confusion.

Make up days will be April 6-9, and 13.

I hope this clarifies any confusion that was created. As always feel free to reach out if you have any questions.

Mr. Netznik
Superintendent

post_text:
Message from the JSHS Administration:
Given the President‚Äôs and Governor‚Äôs recent change in both social distancing guidelines and schools being closed indefinitely, we are going to have to postpone this year‚Äôs prom. Originally the prom was scheduled for April 25th, with yesterday‚Äôs announcement of extending the school's closure, we will not be able to meet timelines or have a gathering this large by this date. We will continue to monitor events to determine if the prom can be rescheduled for a future date. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation during these unprecedented times. I hope each of you is doing well and staying healthy.
text:

Given the President‚Äôs and Governor‚Äôs recent change in both social distancing guidelines and schools being closed indefinitely, we are going to have to postpone this year‚Äôs prom. Originally the prom was scheduled for April 25th, with yesterday‚Äôs announcement of extending the school's closure, we will not be able to meet timelines or have a gathering this large by this date. We will continue to monitor events to determine if the prom can be rescheduled for a future date. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation during these unprecedented times. I hope each of you is doing well and staying healthy.

post_text: All schools in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania are currently closed until April 6, 2020. Now that the Governor has extended the closures, our district will move into the next phase of the COVID-19 closures. Over the last few days, the staff has been planning and prepping for what that next phase will look like. Mr. Netznik, Superintendent, will provide everyone with a district-wide update Wednesday morning.
text: All schools in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania are currently closed until April 6, 2020. Now that the Governor has extended the closures, our district will move into the next phase of the COVID-19 closures. Over the last few days, the staff has been planning and prepping for what that next phase will look like. Mr. Netznik, Superintendent, will provide everyone with a district-wide update Wednesday morning.

post_text:
The Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) announced today all schools in the Commonwealth will remain closed through at least April 6 as a result of the COVID-19 response efforts. The closure order could be extended beyond April 6 if necessary to save lives and stop the spread of COVID-19.

More details will be provided to families in the coming days. While we have been working on various plans for the future, we have been waiting for direction from the Governor before we finalized and implemented those plans.

We thank you for patience as we work through our current situation.

Tulpehocken Junior-Senior High School
February 26 at 9:07 AM ¬∑

Our school is participating in the ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs So Cool About Manufacturing‚Äù video contest for the fourth year. Our school‚Äôs assigned company was Eagle Metals and we have created a short movie about the importance of manufacturing. Voting for the contest starts Wednesday, February 26 and lasts through Friday, February 28.

To vote go to the link provided below (or use the attached QR code). You can then find Tulpehocken‚Äôs video, watch it, and then vote for our school as many times as you would like. The last two years, small schools won the Viewer‚Äôs Choice award (Antietam in 2019 and Mahanoy Area in 2018) so it can be done!!

Share this to family and friends on social media by reposting from the school district accounts. Please support our school and don‚Äôt let us down!

Vote at https://www.whatssocool.org/contests/berks-schuylkill/

post_text:
We are looking for a physics teacher! Please pass the word!!

High School Physics Teacher ‚Äì The Tulpehocken Area School District is seeking applicants for a High School Physics Teacher. Salary is regionally competitive starting at $49,293 or commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should upload an application to PA Reap. Required documents include: letter of interest, resume, PA Standard Application, transcripts, copy of PA Physics 7-12 certificate, (3) reference letters, and Act 151 (Child Abuse), Act 34 (State Police), Act 114 (FBI) Clearances, and Act 24 (Arrest and Conviction Report and Certification) form. Deadline is open until filled.

We are looking for a physics teacher! Please pass the word!!

Deadline is open until filled.

post_text: OPENING: High School Physics Teacher ‚Äì The Tulpehocken Area School District is seeking applicants for a High School Physics Teacher. Salary is regionally competitive with starting at $49,293 or commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should upload an application to PA Reap. Required documents include: letter of interest, resume, PA Standard Application, transcripts, copy of certificate, (3) reference letters, and Act 151 (Child Abuse), Act 34 (State Police), Act 114 (FBI) Clearances, and Act 24 (Arrest and Conviction Report and Certification) form. Deadline is open until filled.

post_text:
CONGRATULATIONS!!!
At the 104th PA Farm Show, the FFA held their mid-winter convention with over 5,000 FFA members and guest in attendance. Tulpehocken had many award recipients. The following first-year members received their FFA jackets:

Madison Blouch
Maya Bicksler
Sara Haag
Regan Kreitzer
Paige Meckley
Jenna Krause
Halle Lytle
Gabby Sembello

The following students received their Keystone Degree:
Austin Deck
Seth Etchberger
Natalie Grumbine
Stephanie Younker

The Keystone Degree is the highest degree that can be bestowed on an FFA member at the state level. Recipients fo the Keystone Degree are chosen through extensive records of supervised agricultural experiences (SAE) submitted by the applicant. Applicants must also meet a number of other requirements, including academic records. Attaining this goal requires up to four years of effort, through leadership development, SAE involvement, and participation in FFA activities both in school and in the community. Only 3 to 4 percent of all FFA members in PA qualify for the degree each year.

Operation Breakfast and Blankets
December 21, 2019 at 1:35 PM ¬∑

Nobody loses when we #BeKind to veterans, children and families who don‚Äôt have a home!!! Monday the Operation‚Äôs üõ∑ will be making our 3rd and final stop in our Christmas 2019 collection. The goal was 200 boxes thanks to Jennifer Becker Bethel Elementary School we had 515 and with Penn-Bernville Parent Teacher Organization we got 212 more boxes and 200+ boxes from Redner's Warehouse Markets shoppers. Wow almost 1000 boxes and hundreds of blankets. #PreventHomelessness #BeKindtoavet #Bekindtokids Berks Coalition to End Homelessness, Inc. Opportunity House

shared_text:
Tulpehocken Area School District
December 13, 2019 at 3:16 PM ¬∑

Job Posting: Part Time Courier position needed as soon as possible. 11 month position 1.5 to 3 hours per day. Driving Cargo van. Delivering Inter department mail. Distributing produce and frozen food orders. Ability to lift a minimum of 50 pounds. Interested candidates can fill out the Support Application found on the Tulpehocken.org website. Also provide employment clearances Act 114, Act 34 and Act 151 (Must be dated within 1 year of Hire date - instructions can be found on the Tulpehocken.org website). Upon hire a physical and TB test will be required on district physical form. Please send all documents to swessner@tulpehocken.org. Deadline to apply is January 10, 2020.
